text:
PARIS: This day has been
a long time coming.

It's the day
of the Battle to Be Golden
Skate Competition,

where the best of the best
get to prove it on the rink.

Teams of all ages
have been working

their big and little
derrières off

at the rare opportunity
of being crowned

The crème de la crème
of skaters at Saturdays.

And when the dust clears,
only a few will go home

rocking one of them
Golden jackets.

That is, if we could stop
freaking out.

♪ Everybody out the way
It's Saturday ♪

♪ Long as I got fun, family
And friends ♪

♪ I got everything
That I need ♪

♪ Everybody out the way
It's Saturday ♪

♪ We ain't got no time
To waste ♪

♪ No work, all play,
No stress ♪

♪ We got everything
That we need ♪

♪ 'Cause there ain't
No other day like Saturday ♪

If I was ever scared
2about this skate competition,

your driving scared it
right out of me.

Glad my lead foot
could help, Ari.

You guys are gonna be back for
the Golden Skate Competition?

Absolutely!
We'll be back in time

to see you three ladies blow up
the spot and become Goldens!

We just have a couple deliveries
to make, then we'll be back.
So see you soon.
As ready as I'm ever gonna get.

Yeah, you know, maybe about one
or two more bathroom trips

All good. Just organizing
the playlist for the skaters.

-Okay.
-Yeah, and I'm marking
the light cues.

And I'm doing
what I'm always doing.

Oh, and Madison, congrats
on that New York
summer music program.

Well, your presence
will be truly missed.

Yo, Madison Ortiz,
you got in?

Yo, that's awesome.
Why didn't you tell me?

I thought about it.
I just...
didn't think it mattered to you.
What? Why would you think that?

Usually, my man,
in situations like these,

I find it's never what you say,
it's what you didn't say.
Okay, then what didn't I say?
Who I look like, Steve Harvey?

It's time to either put up
or shut up.

I'm getting hyped,
and my wings are ready.
Y'all ready to get rolled up?

I don't like how things are
between us.

And it doesn't
have to be this way, Rox.

We've been rocking
for way too long
We can still be friends, right?

You guys sound
just like my parents.

You're gonna lose, girls.
Get ready.

Hmm, she's a feisty
little something, ain't she?

got your chocolate
mini Bundt cakes,

your red velvet streusels,
and your vanilla éclairs.

But when I get tired of him,
which could be any day now,
Why do I feel so dirty?

I just love seeing
the two of you together.

Raising your kids,
running your business.

Been here, what?
Forty, fifty years?

I remember when you
and Mr. Pete

gave me a job sweeping up
when I was little.
And you were terrible at it.
Which is why I went into baking.

No, you went into baking
because you liked to eat.

I just love coming here
every week,

seeing you representing
our community with class.

Well, class
is about to be out.

Oh, baby, don't feel bad.
I'm blessed.

You got some good offers
on the place.

Developers are scooping up
buildings around here

when one door closes,
another one opens.

I'm sure it'll fall
into the right hands.
Let me go ring them up.

I'll see y'all next week,
all right?

It's the Battle to Be Golden
Skate Competition.

Bring the noise.
Bring the heat.

And most of all,
bring them skills on wheels.

You do that,
and you will go home with this.

Not to mention,
you'll be able

One or some of the best skaters
at Saturdays.

All right,
enough of my big mouth.

by Nikka Costa plays)

You're such a fake? ♪

Mr. Perry, it's already
been established

that they are very good, okay?
We witnessed that. Thank you.

If you have anything else
you would like to add,
now would be the time.

Actually, there is something
else I would like to add.
The three of you are very good.

What happened?
Did we run out of gas again?
I'm just afraid to drive away.
Babe, what do you want to do?
What do you want to do?

Well, we do have a storage
and space issue.

And, Cal,
the business is doing so well.

I mean, low overhead
because we work from home.
Baby, I know it's a risk.
And all I want in life

is for you and the kids
to always be happy.

So I'm perfectly fine
doing what we're doing.

But I couldn't ask
for a better life.

-But if you say the word, I--
-Word.

-Mrs. Pecolia,
we would like to make--
-Sold.

Okay, we didn't make you
an offer yet.

No, but I'm about
to make you one.

Now you just got to teach
this one how to sweep.

Thank you!
I see what you did there.

It's ours, baby!
Oh, my God!

This competition
got a brother on edge.

You think Paris and the girls
are ready?

They'd better be. I'm queuing up
their music as we speak.

Look, all they got to do
is go for it.
She keeps dipping on out, man.

And you don't know
what it is?
What kind of face is this?
I do, but that ain't it.

It's the "stop acting like
you ain't got no sense" face.
D, it is not that easy.

You just told me what Paris
and the girls need to do.

Maybe you need to take
your own advice

DUCHESS: And rounding out
the Teenage Trio Division,
give it up for the We-B-Girlz!

by TLC plays)

And rounding out
our newly appointed Goldens

-Oh my God!
-Yes! I told you! I told you!
I think she just said us!

-She just said us. I heard.
-She said us.

Girl, she said us.
She said us.

There was a tie.
And you know what that means.

What does this mean?
I don't understand.

Means there's
about to be a battle!

They don't call it
Battle to Be Golden for nothing.

Girls, I don't get it.
Why are you so nervous?
You just nailed it out there.

Okay, that was then.
This is now.
What if we don't nail it again?

What if this time
we get nailed instead?

Mr. Johnson,
I don't like nails, okay?

You do know you're special,
right?

Okay, this is--
Sit up, girls. Sit up.
Come on. Sit up. Sit up.

they're gonna call y our
three narrow behinds out there

to skate for your dreams
of being what?

Yes. Now you can either
heed the call,
go out there, do your thing,

or you can let fear
overtake you

and rob you of what you've
worked so hard to achieve.
I know Roxie is your friend,

and I know she's going through
a little something

with her parents splitting up,
but that does not mean--

Is that the reason
why she moved back from Jamaica?

I spoke with her dad
a few days ago,

and apparently
she's not taking it that well.

And I wasn't supposed
to say anything.

Look, it doesn't matter,
all right?

Now go out there
and do your thing,

and don't let nothing
take it away from you.

(Derek over P.A.)
Will 2-Cute-4-U and We-B-Girlz
please report to center floor.

CAL: Good luck, girls
. Do your thing.

You know,
your mouth is so big.

Man, that's too bad
about her parents.

Well, at least we know now
where all this energy's
been coming from.

Tell me,
do you like soccer?

'Cause if you do, I'd like
to kick it with you sometime.

Sorry, I'm borrowing this.
Thank you.

Hey, sorry for the interruption,
y'all,

but I need to get something
off my chest.

My boy D said I need to start
following my own advice,

I've been digging you
since the sixth grade.

Since the first day that you
walked into Mrs. Smith's class

And your style was loud,
but proud.

And I remember the day
that you gave me a concussion

Now, actually,
I don't remember much of it,

because I might have lost
a little short-term memory.
And I also know that it'll hurt

if I don't spend as much time
with you as I can

before you go to New York
for the summer.
Can I please be your Summer?

Because I most definitely
would like you to be mine.

Like "yes" like you positive,
or like "yes" like, "kinda"?

I just want to make sure
you ain't getting

Learn how to take "yes"
for an answer.

Now go up there and spin
some records with your Summer.

It's not good
to keep the Duchess waiting.

PARIS: I once said
that this was a story

about three girls
from the South Side of Chicago

who live to get
their skate on.

But now I've learned
that this story
is so much more than that.

That it's a story
about the love of family

And even though some
friendships may come to an end,

we never close the door
on their magnanimous return.

Because at the end of the day,
we're all friends.

And together, we're striving
to make our lives...

PARIS:
I can't wait for next Saturday.

Like wooh ♪
